title: 104_hr3759
content:
The "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" amends various sections of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. Changes include adjusting income levels, increasing the ceiling on investment insurance to $25 billion, raising the ceiling on financing to $20 billion, and updating the issuing authority year to 2001. SEC. 105 of the "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" amends Section 231 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to increase US exports and complement trade policy. SEC. 106 establishes a Board of Directors. Section 233(b) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to remove certain sentences, specify members of the Board including the President of the Corporation, the Administrator of the Agency for International Development, and the United States Trade Representative, and establish a Chairman and Vice Chairman designated by the President of the United States. The President of the United States designates the Chairman and Vice Chairman of the Board from among the Directors, excluding those appointed under specific conditions. TITLE II--TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY

SEC. 201. TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY AUTHORIZATION.

Section 661(f)(1)(A) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to authorize $40,000,000 for fiscal 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998.

TITLE III--EXPORT PROMOTION PROGRAMS WITHIN THE INTERNATIONAL TRADE ADMINISTRATION

SEC. 301. EXPORT PROMOTION AUTHORIZATION.

Section 202 of the Export Administration Amendments Act of 1985 is amended to authorize $240,000,000 for fiscal year 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998.

TITLE IV--TRADE PROMOTION COORDINATING COMMITTEE

SEC. 401. STRATEGIC EXPORT PLAN. TITLE IV--TRADE PROMOTION COORDINATING COMMITTEE

SEC. 401. STRATEGIC EXPORT PLAN.

Amends the Export Enhancement Act to provide more coordinated export promotion services for small- and medium-sized businesses and establish priorities for promoting US exports and free market reforms in the Middle East to stimulate job growth. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee is tasked with identifying and eliminating overlap and duplication in Federal export promotion activities, promoting better coordination between State, Federal, and private sector export promotion activities, and including these matters in the annual report by September 30, 1997. Additionally, there is a section on private sector development in Ukraine. SEC. 403. PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT IN THE UKRAINE. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee will report on its efforts to promote US trade and investment for private sector development in Ukraine in the 1997 annual report.
